instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Air M1 dead
threads.message:
Hey i have a problem with this M1 Macbook.
It comes in with a shorted UF400.
I replaced this but still no boot.

In the first seconds when i plug it in. It takes 200 mA. And the it stays on 27 mA.
I tried DFU also. No DFU possible, i tried even with force dfu pins.


I checked 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> = 12,00V
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> = 3.8V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2</SIGNAL> = 5,19V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> = 3,3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC0_LDO</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL>= 5,1V

I dont know what to check more. Can you help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Air M1 dead
threads.message:
USB-C ports switch to 20V now?

UF400 controls DFU, so you may still have a problem there.
Be sure to use good/compatible chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Air M1 dead
threads.message:
noo i stays on 5V

ok i will buy another one
